wikipedia_page.main: Henry Edward Hugh Pelham-Clinton-Hope, 9th Duke of Newcastle-under-Lyne,  (8 April 1907 – 4 November 1988), styled Earl of Lincoln from 1928 to 1941, was a British peer and aviator.

response: In 1981, Mancuso married Lady Patricia Pelham-Clinton-Hope (born 1949), a daughter of Henry Pelham-Clinton-Hope, 9th Duke of Newcastle, but they were divorced in 1983.Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage (Debrett's Peerage Limited, 2008), p. 1,055 He later married his second wife, Canadian actress Barbara Williams before divorcing. In 1998, he married his third wife Toronto-born actress Nadia Capone. The two have one child together.

In the 1950s, the house was bought by Henry Pelham-Clinton-Hope, 9th Duke of Newcastle, and became the family seat, his house at Clumber Park, Nottinghamshire, having been demolished in 1938 and its estate sold in 1946.

response: **Lady Mary Diana Montagu-Stuart-Wortley (2 June 1920 – 19 September 1997), married Henry Pelham-Clinton-Hope, 9th Duke of Newcastle, and had issue
* Lady Mary Montagu-Stuart-Wortley (1920–1997), 2nd wife of Henry Pelham-Clinton-Hope, 9th Duke of Newcastle
* Sally Ann Wemyss, 3rd wife of Henry Pelham-Clinton-Hope, 9th Duke of Newcastle

In the 1880s the house was bought by Charles Morley the Member of Parliament for Breconshire. The house was altered in 1896 by Ernest George and Alfred B. Yeates.  The Morley family owned the house until 1955. In 1961 it was bought by Henry Pelham-Clinton-Hope, 9th Duke of Newcastle who sold it in 1970 to the W.D. & H.O. Wills tobacco company who used it as a training centre.
*Henry Pelham-Clinton-Hope, 9th Duke of Newcastle (1907–1988), British peer and aviator
